Description: Schist commemorative scarab, much damaged. Base inscribed with seven surviving lines of hieroglyphic script commemorating arrival of Gilukhepa at court of Amenhotep III.
Curator's comments: Six copies survive of the Gilukhepa commemorative scarab type, two in the British Museum collection (EA49707 and EA68507). For more on Amenhotep III commemorative scarabs and the Gilukhepa type, see: Berman, L. 1992. 'Large Commemorative Scarabs' in Egypt's dazzling sun: Amenhotep III and his world, 67-69 Gundlach, R. 2002. 'Die Gedenkskarabäen Amenophis' III.: ihre Ideologie und historische Bedeutung' in Festschrift Arne Eggebrecht: zum 65. Geburtstag am 12. März 2000, 31-46 Baines, J. 2003. 'On the genre and purpose of the 'large commemorative scarabs' of Amenhotep III' in Hommages à Fayza Haikal, 29-43 Siat, K. 2021. 'Amenhotep III & Tiye. The commemorative scarab series: asserting royal equality' Nile Magazine 29, 11-23
Bibliographic references: Hall 1913 / Catalogue of Egyptian scarabs, etc. in the British Museum (No.1716)
Blankenberg-Van Delden 1969 / The large commemorative scarabs of Amenhotep III (p. 131, D2)
